why: Moving with control and awareness improves outcomes more than sheer volume.

slides.title: Movement Quality
slides.content: Research shows that movement quality (control, awareness, intention) often matters more than sheer volume or intensity.

slides.title: Evidence-Based Approach
slides.content: Focus on pain-free movement patterns, smooth tempo, and maintaining good form rather than pushing through pain.

slides.title: Common Mistakes
slides.content: Racing through reps, ignoring pain signals, prioritizing quantity over control, and holding breath during movement.

slides.title: Progressive Approach
slides.content: Start with bodyweight control and pain-free range; gradually increase load only when movement quality is consistent.

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: More reps = better. Fact: Better reps = better.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: Film one set; score control 1â€“5; repeat set slower with steadier breath.
